009package imagingbook.pub.hough.lines;
010
011import java.util.Locale;
012
013import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
014import imagingbook.pub.geometry.lines.AlgebraicLine;
015import imagingbook.pub.geometry.lines.HessianLine;
016
017/**
018 * This class represents a straight line used by the Hough transform
019 * (see {@link imagingbook.pub.hough.HoughTransformLines}).
020 * It inherits from {@link HessianLine} which is, in turn, a subclass of 
021 * {@link AlgebraicLine}.
022 * It adds an arbitrary reference point and a counter for pixel votes.
023 */
024public class HoughLine extends HessianLine implements Comparable<HoughLine> {
025        
026        private final int count;                        // pixel votes for this line
027        private final double xRef, yRef;        // reference point
028        
029        
030        // static factory methods -------------------------------
031        
032        public static HoughLine fromPoints(Pnt2d p1, Pnt2d p2, Pnt2d pRef, int count) {
033                return new HoughLine(AlgebraicLine.fromPoints(p1, p2), pRef.getX(), pRef.getY(), count);
034        }
035        
036        // constructors -----------------------------------------
037        
038        public HoughLine(double a, double b, double c, double xR, double yR, int count) {
039                super(a, b, c);
040                this.xRef = xR;
041                this.yRef = yR;
042                this.count = count;
043        }
044
045        /**
046         * Constructor.
047         * @param angle the line's normal angle (see {@link HessianLine})
048         * @param radius the line's radius (distance to reference point)
049         * @param xRef reference point x-coordinate
050         * @param yRef reference point y-coordinate
051         * @param count pixel votes for this line
052         */
053        public HoughLine(double angle, double radius, double xRef, double yRef, int count) {
054                super(angle, radius);
055                this.xRef = xRef;
056                this.yRef = yRef;
057                this.count = count;
058        }
059        
060        /**
061         * Constructor. 
062         * Creates a new {@link HoughLine} instance from a given
063         * {@link AlgebraicLine} (or any subclass) instance.
064         * The line parameters are adjusted to the specified reference point
065         * (actually only parameter c is modified, since a change of reference point
066         * effects only a shift of the line).
067         * The two lines are equivalent, i.e., contain the same points (x,y).
068         * Thus the distance from a given point (x,y) is the same from the original
069         * line and the new line.
070         * @param line an existing line ({@link AlgebraicLine} or subclass)
071         * @param xR reference point x-coordinate
072         * @param yR reference point y-coordinate
073         * @param count pixel votes for this line
074         */
075        public HoughLine(AlgebraicLine line, double xR, double yR, int count) {
076                super(line.getA(),
077                          line.getB(),
078                          line.getC() + line.getA()*(xR-line.getXref()) + line.getB()*(yR-line.getYref())); // = a', b', c'
079                this.xRef = xR;
080                this.yRef = yR;
081                this.count = count;
082        }
083        
084        // getter/setter methods ------------------------------------------
085        
086        /**
087         * @return The accumulator count associated with this line.
088         */
089        public int getCount() {
090                return count;
091        }
092        
093        @Override
094        public double getXref() {
095                return xRef;
096        }
097        
098        @Override
099        public double getYref() {
100                return yRef;
101        }
102        
103        // other methods ------------------------------------------
104        
105        /**
106         * Required by the {@link Comparable} interface, used for sorting lines by their
107         * point count (in descending order, i.e., strong lines come first).
108         * @param other another {@link HoughLine} instance.
109         */
110        @Override
111        public int compareTo(HoughLine other) {
112                return Integer.compare(other.count, this.count);
113        }
114        
115        @Override
116        public String toString() {
117                return String.format(Locale.US, "%s <angle = %.3f, radius = %.3f, xRef = %.3f, yRef = %.3f, count = %d>",
118                                this.getClass().getSimpleName(), getAngle(), getRadius(), getXref(), getYref(), count);
119        }
120        
121        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
122        
123
124//      /**
125//       * Creates a vector line to be used an element in an ImageJ graphic overlay
126//       * (see {@link ij.gui.Overlay}). The length of the displayed line 
127//       * is equivalent to the distance of the reference point (typically the
128//       * image center) to the coordinate origin.
129//       * @return the new line
130//       * @deprecated
131//       */
132//      public PolygonRoi makeLineRoi() {
133//              double length = Math.sqrt(xRef * xRef + yRef * yRef);
134//              return this.makeLineRoi(length);
135//      }
136        
137//      /**
138//       * Creates a vector line to be used an element in an ImageJ graphic overlay
139//       * (see {@link ij.gui.Overlay}). The length of the displayed line 
140//       * is measured from its center point (the point closest to the reference
141//       * point) in both directions.
142//       * 
143//       * @param length the length of the line
144//       * @return the new line
145//       */
146//      public PolygonRoi makeLineRoi(double length) {
147//              // unit vector perpendicular to the line
148//              double dx = Math.cos(angle);    
149//              double dy = Math.sin(angle);
150//              // calculate the line's center point (closest to the reference point)
151//              double x0 = xRef + radius * dx;
152//              double y0 = yRef + radius * dy;
153//              // calculate the line end points (using normal vectors)
154//              float x1 = (float) (x0 + dy * length);
155//              float y1 = (float) (y0 - dx * length);
156//              float x2 = (float) (x0 - dy * length);
157//              float y2 = (float) (y0 + dx * length);
158//              float[] xpoints = { x1, x2 };
159//              float[] ypoints = { y1, y2 };
160//              return new PolygonRoi(xpoints, ypoints, Roi.POLYLINE);
161//      }
162
163}
